intro: Hippeastrum leucanthum, commonly known as the white hurricane lily, is a striking bulbous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, strap-shaped leaves and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces large, bell-shaped blooms that are often adorned with a distinctive red or purple stripe. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Hippeastrum leucanthum is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
